attributes.action: Increase Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) from 39 weeks to 52 weeks
attributes.background: It is important that new parents should not be put off taking their full entitlement to Maternity Leave for 52 weeks because they will not receive payment for the last 13 weeks of their leave. Currently SMP is only payable for the first 39 weeks of Maternity Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
The House of Commons Library contains a document entitled "Maternity pay and leave" dated 13 January 2010. It states that in December 2004 the Government announced a goal of extending maternity pay to twelve
months, from what was then 26 weeks (6 months). Although progress has been made and maternity pay is now paid for 39 weeks (9 months), I believe it is an important social issue to get that extra extension to 52 weeks (12 months).

attributes.action: Stop the purchase of gas boilers and associated parts without a registration.
attributes.background: If the law stated, that selling and buying both domestic and commercial Gas, Oil and LPG boilers and associated parts, without governing body registrations became law, the dangerous practice of unqualified and dangerous installations would cease. Thus improving the safety for all and save lives.

attributes.action: Stop reducing child maintenance monies by allowing travel expenses to be claimed
attributes.background: Did you know that when child maintenance monies are awarded through the CMO (previously CSA) they allow the non resident parent to claim travel expenses (regardless of how far they wish to move away) against the child maintenance award thus lowering it further. Stop disadvantaging our children.
attributes.additional_details: Child maintenance is normally sought via the CMO as a last resort when other avenues have been explored for fairness for the child. The key focus for resident and non resident parent should be THE CHILD and providing financial and emotional stability as if you hadn’t separated.  This claiming process looks to add conflict. Child maintenance was set up to aid THE CHILD. The non-resident could chose to move away 100’s of miles away yet the child would be monetarily disadvantaged as a result.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for drivers to hit and run when hitting a domestic animal
attributes.background: This point needs to be put into action because domesticated animals being killed with no justice is no option and should be a criminal offence. When an animal companion is removed it leaves people feeling very alone and broken, looking for justice that currently can’t be served - personal experience

attributes.action: Scrap Part P, someone with 5 days experience is not safe to work on electrics
attributes.background: The public are being mislead on the terminology of what makes an electrician, often employing a Part P company over and approved electrician as they believe Part P is the same as Gas Safe.
attributes.additional_details:
Electrician training
3 or 4 Years ( and must have served as apprentice)
Exams;
level 2 - 6 units consisting of practical and theory exams 
level 3  - 7 units consisting of practical and theory exams
NVQ 3 - At least 1 year served and assessed by competent electrician with evidence of all areas of electrical work
AM2 - 16.5 hour exam on practical skills and theory
Regulations - online exam 

Part P Domestic Electrical Installer training
5 Days
Exams;
40min multiple choice Exam

attributes.action: Promote drug harm reduction information and services
attributes.background: There were 3744 drug related deaths in the UK in 2016. The government currently provides no official harm reduction information or services. 35% of the UK's population have taken drugs in their lifetime. The government needs to promote harm reduction information and provide testing services.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is to promote harm reduction in the UK in the following ways: 
- Allow licenced premises to test drugs 
- Make drugs reagent kits readily available 
- Make pharmacies have reagents where drugs can be tested for free anonymously 
- Promote information on how to use drugs safely
- Promote information on what to do in an emergency situation for a friend or family member
These services will cut drug deaths and save the NHS money. Statistics about deaths and usage are from drugwise.org

attributes.action: Abolition of the coarse fishing closed season on rivers (16th March-16th June)
attributes.background: This outdated law has left us Angler’s twiddling our thumbs for years, there is no evidence to prove all year round fishing harms fish’s breeding habits, no effects have been seen on commercial fisheries and canals which have had no closed season for years.
attributes.additional_details: We have also seen the loss of Tackle & bait shops for years during the closed season as takings reduce massively, fishing seems to be a dying hobby which is a crying shame as kids and adults alike could do with more outside pastimes not less. More fishing time and longer evenings (in closed season) can give the sport and local businesses a real boost and give more opportunities for people to take up Angling.

attributes.action: Include courses on the awareness of terminal illnesses in schools
attributes.background: Include courses in the PSHE curriculum to teach children about terminal illnesses in our schools, and how to deal with them.
attributes.additional_details: Many children do not know how to react to and deal with a family member, friend, or themselves being diagnosed with terminal illnesses such as cancer.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health services exempt from VAT.
attributes.background: Mental Health services such as Addiction Counselling (Food, Drugs, Alcohol etc), Psychotherapy and Trauma Counselling currently are all deemed as VATable expenses which makes them a “Luxury Item” this means that Thousands of people are having to pay extra for the help they desperately need!
attributes.additional_details: Currently services such as Equine Therapy, Art Therapy and Speech Therapy are all VAT Exempt so why not important potentially life saving/ changing services? If this government is serious about helping people with mental health issues then drop the VAT and help to make the services they need more affordable.

attributes.action: Go back to the old GCSEs and abolish the new 9-1 Grading system
attributes.background: The new GCSEs are incredibly difficult and it results in many students failing or getting low grades. The new system has set students for failure and has even increased the difficulty to that of the old A-levels. This is inconsiderate and unjust. We must abolish this system.

attributes.action: Stop pharmacies from throwing away unused drugs returned when no longer required
attributes.background: When a patient has no further use for prescribed drugs, we are encouraged to return them to a pharmacy. However, current practice is to destroy the drugs, even when it can easily be confirmed whether or not the drugs have already been opened. This wasteful practice should end, saving the NHS money.

attributes.action: Invest more money in youth charities and youth service providers in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a profound reduction in services for young people resulting from funding cuts. With huge pressures on all local authority budgets, these cuts won’t be reversed. We have to support the organisations who help young people from areas with high levels of deprivation and low income backgrounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2012, in London alone at least £22 million has been cut from council youth service budgets and 12,700 places for young people have been lost. The average council has cut its youth service budget by nearly £1 million, an average of 36%. (London's Lost Youth Services, 2017).

Across the country more than 1 in 10 think their life will amount to nothing, no matter how hard they try. 42% of young people feel traditional goals like getting a steady job are unrealistic (Prince's Trust, 2017).

attributes.action: Offer legal aid for all women/ men who have been a victim of domestic abuse
attributes.background: Legal aid is not currently available to all domestic abuse survivors. There are very specific conditions you must meet to be valid, which does not take into consideration any financial abuse or manipulation, which has left a lot of victims struggling to pay off debt and get divorced at the same time

attributes.action: Any NEWSPAPER to be bound like BBC: to be fair, balanced, truthful and accurate.
attributes.background: At top of cover page, all publications to declare themselves to be a Newspaper, or Propaganda Sheet, Party Political publication, Advertising material, Lifestyle magazine, Specific Interest Publication. We need to know what we buy, just as we differentiate between reportage and advertisement.
attributes.additional_details:
The reason for this need is the existence of daily publications which:
•	deliberately distort their reporting by selection of facts, 
•	selectively headline items with a disproportionate emphasis on some topics, 
•	repeat items as if they were new or current when they are not, 
•	use biased, inflammatory or pejorative language, 
•	set a tone which encourages divisiveness and prejudice against particular groups or beliefs.
This is a serious and growing problem, today and in recent years.

attributes.action: Make broadcasters have content warnings and signpost support for mental illness
attributes.background: While some depictions of people's battles with mental illness in the media can oftentimes be accurate representations and this should be applauded it should also be done safely taking potential risks to the viewer/listener into account by offering warnings before the programme and signposting after.
attributes.additional_details:
Great strides have been made by some TV broadcasters to raise awareness of mental illness by depicting it so accurately, and some broadcasters exemplify how such a sensitive topic should be handled.

However I have noticed how web-based broadcasters offer no warnings of content and offer no signposting after the programme. 

This is potentially dangerous and I feel strongly that people who are vulnerable should be able to enjoy these programmes but know where to find help if needed afterwards.

attributes.action: Bring back vehicle tax discs
attributes.background: The number of unlicensed vehicles on the road has tripled since the paper tax disc was abolished. Government figures point to lost revenue of £107m from 755,000 unlicensed vehicles last year. Scrapping the tax disc was meant to save £10m a year, but it failed. The government needs to do a u-turn.
attributes.additional_details: See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-42009111 for more background

attributes.action: Minimum of 10 years for causing death by careless or dangerous driving
attributes.background: Too many people are being killed by drivers being drunk, on drugs or using mobile phones will driving.

attributes.action: Have Dartford Crossing contribute towards the cost of the lower Thames crossing.
attributes.background: The public was told the Dartford Crossing was to be made free back in 1999. 19 years later we're still being charged. For this reason alone i believe it would be fair to have money from Dartford crossing to go towards some of the lower Thames build.

attributes.action: Amend Hate Speech Laws
attributes.background: "Hate Crime is any criminal offence [...] which is perceived to be motivated by hostility or prejudice." Law enforcement will find it difficult to fully determine the motivations behind the speech or actions. As such, the law should be changed to "proven to be motivated by" to avoid ambiguity.

attributes.action: Make sure that there are recycling bins in the classrooms of every school.
attributes.background: As a student, everyday I see a shocking amount of paper go to landfill. I understand that in the current environmental climate, we should be doing all we can to create minimal waste. By ensuring there are recycling bins in every classroom teachers and students could be compelled to act.
attributes.additional_details: Every day students are using worksheets and paper in lesson, however, instead of putting used paper in a recycling bin it is put in the normal bins to go to landfill. I find this shocking, I myself believe that recycling is such an easy way to prevent waste going to landfill sites. There is an easy way to combat this problem, by ensuring every classroom in every school across the country has a recycling bin, many more teachers and students could be compelled to recycle their paper.

attributes.action: Amend the knife law: Ban drop point blades and thumb studs.
attributes.background: Knife crime is a serious problem in our nation. Drop and clip point blades (blades with a point designed to achieve greater penetration when used to stab) and thumb studs (nubs of metal that allow a knife to be rapidly opened with one hand) should be banned to reduce the severity of knife attacks.
attributes.additional_details:
Current knife law is designed around preventing stabbings and keeping our streets safe. (https://www.gov.uk/buying-carrying-knives) Drop and clip point knives are not restricted under this law. These knife types are designed to cause worse stab wounds. (https://www.knife-depot.com/knife-information-105.html, https://www.knife-depot.com/knife-information-104.html)
Thumb studs (also legal) convert knives into switchblades in all but name. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-zCMe1q8MY8)

attributes.action: Permit all public universities to test cannabis for medical use
attributes.background: Cannabis is widely believed to have broad medical applications, and there is solid evidence to support some of these. We cannot know the true extent without research. It seems obvious that the current restriction is based on ideology rather than evidence, and this stance is academically unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis has been shown to improve the endurance of cancer patients and to improve the experiences of those with chronic pain.  Cannabis has also been shown to be minimally addictive and minimally harmful to health, whilst the debate over its social detriments has contained more heat than light.  The way to put this to bed, one way or the other, is to let the academics test it and find out exactly what it does.  We permit tests on other classes of drugs including opiates, why not cannabis?

attributes.action: Make branding or freeze branding of animals a criminal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Many horses and cattle in the UK are branded using heated iron or frozen metal (freeze branding). This is cruel, causing severe pain and is unnecessary when micro-chipping is cheap and quick. It could even be made illegal without new legislation by enforcing existing anti-cruelty laws.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information
https://www.rspca.org.uk/adviceandwelfare/pets/horses/health/identification
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows/

attributes.action: Government to pay for all car repairs caused by potholes
attributes.background: We all pay car tax and council tax and yet our roads are left in unsafe and damaged conditions many of witch need ripping up and relaying completely which can cause serious damage to our cars. Having paid the tax, we should not have to pay for any damage to wheels, suspension, track rods, cv joints.
attributes.additional_details: These roads are being reported yet only a temporary fix or not at all until such time the roads are safe to drive on with out the risk of damage the local council or government should pick up the bills.

attributes.action: Divert the money used for foreign aid to fund the NHS as a temporary measure.
attributes.background:
Diverting overseas aid may seem wrong but we have many UK citizens of many ethnic backgrounds who are suffering because of lack of funding to the NHS and many of our citizens are dying needlessly.
The aid funding can be restored once we have put the NHS back on a proper footing.

attributes.action: Give the money we will spend making UK passports blue to the NHS
attributes.background: Blue passports are little more than a hidden cost of Brexit and a vanity project. No one either for or against Brexit could possibly believe that the colour of our passports is more important than the health of society.

attributes.action: Make the drink driving limit for alcohol zero
attributes.background: This action would remove ambiguity for everyone and would lead to increased safety on the Uk roads

attributes.action: Specialised glasses for the colour-blind on the NHS
attributes.background:
Imagine opening you eyes every morning and everything is browns yellows and dark blues.
Imagine growing up realising there's a whole new world of colours, yet your unable to see what others see. Reds, pinks, purples, oranges, light blues are some of the basic colours that a victim of Deuteranopia
attributes.additional_details:
My aim in this petitions is to try and fight to get glasses for the colour-blind available on the NHS. Why? 
•Children experiencing difficulty at school if colours are used to help with learning 
•Problems with food, such as identifying whether meat is fully cooked or whether fruit is ripe 
•Getting medications confused 
•Trouble identifying safety warnings or signs 
•Slightly limited career choices – certain jobs, such as pilots, train drivers and electricians

attributes.action: Make all referendums require 60% of the vote to effect a change
attributes.background: We vote for M.P.s to make decisions on our behalf. They have the time to research and debate issues appropriately. When major decisions are handed over to the population, there is a significant risk of voting being based on  emotional or personal rather than objective reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
There is (as seems to have been the case in the USA and the UK recently) much greater risk of external agencies inappropriately influencing the vote.  And those agencies\individuals who have greater financial resources (and probably lobbying interests) can also unfairly influence the voting patterns.
A 60% majority would to some extent indicate a genuine ground swell of opinion towards the change.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks after 5th November.
attributes.background:
I appreciate that Bonfire Night is going to be celebrated each and every year with fireworks, without fail. However, a lot of people and animals become extremely distressed during this time. 
Fireworks going on for weeks after Bonfire Night is completely unnecessary.

attributes.action: Create a Memorial Day for all killed working in emergency services
attributes.background: Many people in the emergency services sadly lose their lives while carrying out their duty. We should create a day to remember them, separate from Remembrance Sunday and other memorial days.

attributes.action: Utility companies to be responsible for repairing potholes around poor repairs
attributes.background: A majority of potholes form around places of existing weakness, such as road repair works following companies digging up the roads for routine maintenance.  These companies should be responsible for filling any potholes that are a consequence of a road weakness following their actions
attributes.additional_details:
Potholes are caused when water penetrates cracks in the road. When this water freezes, it expands, widening the cracks. When it melts, traffic smashes new craters into the road surface.  Other countries do not have many drains and services under their roads, and do not give privatised utility companies the right to dig up a new road
An increasing number of road users are taking legal action. The AA estimates that the cost to insurers of claims (pothole damage) was £2.85m during February alone.

attributes.action: Change the methods the Government use to record Homelessness
attributes.background: The methods currently used by the Government to record Homelessness portray unrealistic results. Many people are concealed in the 'hidden homelessness' category as they sofa surf or move around on the streets. Current figures are an underestimate, many are not included in the official statistics.
attributes.additional_details: Many people who the average citizen would classify as homeless are neglected from the record as they do not fit Government criteria. We cannot ignore the lives of individuals simply because they are not "lying down in the street" and instead are hiding in the crevice of a doorway. If the Government change the way they record homelessness to give a more representative statistic, as a united country we can tackle this issue with full knowledge of what we are facing.

attributes.action: Make It Mandatory for Employers to Educate Employees on "Employment Rights"
attributes.background:
Discrimination at work is a harsh reality of British Labour Market. This is mainly due to lack of training among the employers and lack of understanding of rights among the employees. 
The only way to protect ourselves and next generation is to make it mandatory for employers to educate their staff
attributes.additional_details:
Equality and Human Rights Commission on 21/12/2017 reported that ethnic minorities have a 12.9% higher unemployment rate.

Black workers with degrees earn 23.1% less on average.

In Britain, only 8.8% of the minorities worked at a manager level or higher.

Based on GOV statistics from Jan-Sep 2017:
13% of the jurisdictional complaints were related to Equal Pay
11.7% for discrimination of some kind.

These numbers are alarming!

So please sign the petition and protect our rights.EDUCATE EMPLOYEES

attributes.action: Prohibit the act of infant male circumcision without a proper medical reasoning.
attributes.background: Male circumcision in infants is an unnecessary, irreversible and unfair procedure to place upon a boy who may in the future disagree with the reasons for which it was done. Religion and parental opinion are not appropriate reasons to remove a part of a boys body when they lack the ability to refuse.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition goes against strapping a infant boy to a table and cutting away at his genitals without medical reasoning. It does not go against voluntary circumcision by a consenting person.
Issue's like Phimosis, are an appropriate reason to conduct such a procedure as the condition is uncomfortable and fixable. It is known the procedure has no link to higher chances of STD's or HIV in the western world. Promoting safe sex is an alternative to preemptive surgery that is in turn irreversible.

attributes.action: Mandatory for all alcoholic beverages to display nutritional information
attributes.background: I suffer with type 1 diabetes but want to lead a normal life. Identifying the total carbohydrate content of a beer from various internet searches is difficult and unreliable. Furthmore we have a nation of growing waistbands, shouldn't the calorific content of alcohol be visible to inform consumers?

attributes.action: Make it a crime to remove dairy calves' teats without anaesthetic & pain relief
attributes.background: Many dairy calves have extra or "supernumerary" teats removed with a scalpel or scissors. It is only "recommended" to provide anaesthetic. Not legally required to provide anaesthetic and pain relief medication afterwards
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see the following links
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf
http://adlib.everysite.co.uk/adlib/defra/content.aspx?id=000IL3890W.182WIKRB434ZN7
http://www.gov.scot/Publications/2009/06/18114130/10

attributes.action: Restrict child benefit to the first two children in a family
attributes.background: The population of the world generally and of the UK specifically is growing at an alarming rate. The government should not be subsidising parents who choose to have larger families. It is therefore proposed that child benefit should be capped at two children per family

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys from restaurant kids meals
attributes.background: As part of a concerted effort to reduce plastic consumption, we should tackle the easy target of removing the toys given as part of happy meals from restaurants such as McDonald's and Burger King. These toys could easily be replaced with something more educational and environmentally friendly.

attributes.action: Set up a Royal Commission to look into the funding model and use of the NHS
attributes.background: The funding model of the NHS has been a political football for decades, yet it is perhaps the more fundamental of services. Its funding is too important to be decided by the conflicting interests of political parties. It's use needs to be examined to decide whether its current use is sustainable

attributes.action: Ban private parking firms from operating within the NHS.
attributes.background: I recently had to spend a lot of time visiting my ill mother in hospital. It opened my eyes to the fact so many people have huge worries regarding parking to see to their loved ones as the cost is so high. The worst bit about it is not a penny was going back into the hospital but to a private firm.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website states:
Charges should be reasonable for the area.
Concessions, including free or reduced charges or caps, should be available for the following groups:
Disabled people
Frequent outpatient attenders
Visitors with relatives who are gravely ill, or carers of such people
Visitors to relatives who have an extended stay in hospital, or carers of such people
Carers of people in the above groups where appropriate.
My recent visits of £18 per day is certainly not within these guidelines.

attributes.action: Ban the testing of household cleaning product ingredients on animals.
attributes.background: There is no law in the UK that bans the testing of cleaning products on animals. This is a cruel practice with no practical use whatsoever. I urge you to please sign this petition if you , like me love animals and do not want to see them suffer.

attributes.action: Increase the hourly funding rate for Early Years Education
attributes.background:
Early Years Funding is in Crisis!

National Living Wage is increasing by 4.4% in April.  Employer pension contributions are increasing to 2% at the same time.
Guess how much our funding has gone up by?
0%

Early years providers are closing, please sign and save FREE Early Years Education!
attributes.additional_details:
We have to sign a contract stating it is ILLEGAL for us to get parents to pay top ups to cover the short fall in funding.  Not that they should of course, as the government advertise it as FREE childcare after all!

No other business has what it can charge their customers dictated to them.  The government control what we receive and what we can charge and the result is a deficit for most providers.

Please help is get an increase in funding, in line with the increase of business costs.

attributes.action: To move Parliament to new buildings more suitable for 21st century Britain
attributes.background: To look at building a new Houses of Parliament, more suitable for a 21st century Britain, that shows clearly, MPs are public servants, elected by the people, to serve the people. The current premises are alien to a modern, successful country
attributes.additional_details: The current Houses of Parliament will make a fantastic British historic building to open up for the public, will pay for itself in visitors and events.

attributes.action: Change the 5p charge for plastic bags to 10p and replace with bags for life
attributes.background: The introduction of the 5p bag charge in 2015 reduced usage in England by 85% but there is still work to be done to minimise our negative impact on the environment, especially marine life. An increase would raise more money for charities and replacing single use with bags for life will reduce waste.
attributes.additional_details:
A ten week trial by Tesco to stop selling single use 5p carrier bags and offering 10p reusable bags for life recently saw a 25% reduction in bag sales as shoppers either brought their own or purchased the more expensive bag (made from 94% recyclable material). 

This move will help fewer bags needing to be sent to landfill while continuing to generate money from bag sales that goes directly to environmental charities.

attributes.action: Make teaching coping mechanisms compulsory in secondary schools
attributes.background: At 8 years-old I lost my mum to cancer, and I'd never dealt with it until 20 years later, because I wasn't equipped with adequate coping mechanisms. Children everywhere are unequipped to deal with trauma they experience on a daily basis, and the stress of later life, I'd like to change that.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 British people suffer from mental health problems, and depression is 10x more widespread than it was just a decade ago (demonstrating its alarming growth under societal changes). 85% of adults experience stress on a regular basis; a cause of anxiety, depression, panic attacks and insomnia. Suicide is the biggest cause of death in men betweeh 20 - 49. And LGBT people are more likely to experience mental health problems, and less likely to have support systems.

attributes.action: Condemn Israeli Army killings of 30 unarmed Palestinian protestors in Gaza
attributes.background: On Friday 30th March this year Palestinians living in the Gaza Strip gathered at various points along the border with Israel to peacefully protest the blockade and demand their right of return to homes that they had been driven out of in 1948 during the Nakba. Now 30 are dead and 1000+ injured.
attributes.additional_details: The 1948 Palestinian exodus, also known as the Nakba, literally "disaster", "catastrophe", or "cataclysm"), occurred when more than 700,000 Palestinian Arabs fled or were expelled from their homes, during the 1948 Palestine war. Between 400 and 600 Palestinian villages were sacked during the war, while urban Palestine was almost entirely extinguished. The term "nakba" also refers to the period of war itself and events affecting Palestinians from December 1947 to January 1949

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and put the money into road repairs and improvement.
attributes.background:
Pot holes are causing serious damage to vehicles and injury to road users such cyclists and motorcyclists. All are at serious risk.

So cancel HS2 with its budget of £15 billion and put the money to work right away on the roads. That will benefit more people than a high speed rail link.

attributes.action: Make mandatory that vehicle manufacturers install remotely activated immobiliser
attributes.background: To assist with vehicles that 'fail to stop' for police and being used as weapons in terror attacks, all vehicles should be fitted with remotely activated immobilisers which can be activated by authorities or owners if thier vehicle is stolen or used in crime.
attributes.additional_details: This will help prevent the many deaths we have seen in police pursuits and vehicles being used as weapons in recent terror attacks.

attributes.action: Cap council tax at 2% per annum maximum from 2019 onwards
attributes.background:
Many pensioners and early retirees have fixed incomes (annuity pensions).
The last two years have seen an 11% increase in council tax which is proving increasingly difficult to pay.
